data.title: Amazon.com: Jim Henson: The Biography: 9780345526113: Jones, Brian Jay: Books
data.meta_description: Amazon.com: Jim Henson: The Biography: 9780345526113: Jones, Brian Jay: Books
data.text:
Customers find the book excellent, interesting, sad, funny, and thorough. They say it gives a personal glimpse at a visionary and leaves them feeling inspired. Readers describe the author as wonderful and incredible. They mention that the book gives them a better understanding of how these events developed.

"...The overall story is inspirational. You can see the power of an idea and a dream. This book takes you deep into this world...." Read more

"This may be the best biography I’ve ever read, well-researched and beautifully written. While under its spell, I felt immersed in creative energy...." Read more

Customers find the book very detailed, excellent, and touching on many aspects of Jim Henson that they never knew. They also describe him as curious, intelligent, kind, gentle, and hardworking. Readers also mention the book is nicely compiled and a great view of the talented, creative, and working man.

"...The book is full of information you won't find anywhere else.I was memorized by the little stories about Jim and his work...." Read more

"...the real Jim Henson, and he was just as funny, kind, imaginative, intelligent, and crazy as the little glimpses of him that I caught occasionally on..." Read more

"...The book is very detailed but never boring. (I was drawn to this since I attended the same school—University of Maryland, College Park.)..." Read more

"...(or listen to) book, so compliments to Brian Jay Jones for his excellent research, thorough interviews, and easy and understandable writing style...." Read more

Customers find the story entertaining, informative, and worth the good cry. They also say the book is a thorough journey into the work of Jim Henson, with boundless enthusiasm and energy. Customers also say it's dedicated, creative, and well written.

"I bought this book on a whim a few months ago, and it was an excellent call...." Read more

"...all, as I read, I got to know the real Jim Henson, and he was just as funny, kind, imaginative, intelligent, and crazy as the little glimpses of him..." Read more

"...“Take always” for me are his passion, focus, professionalism, his being an awesome father to his kids, his ability to bring out the best in his co-..." Read more

"...is very subdued: there is no ups and downs, it's not very conscious on the read through but on reflection when bad things happen, they aren't so bad...." Read more

"...I got to know the real Jim Henson, and he was just as funny, kind, imaginative, intelligent, and crazy as the little glimpses of him that I caught..." Read more

"...You really get a feel for the man, Jim Henson. He was extraordinarily creative and driven, with a sort of innate inner strength and conviction, and..." Read more

"...by the works of Mr. Henson - a true innovator with his craft and an imaginative, creative genius...." Read more

Customers find the character traits in the book great, with strength, conviction, and compassion. They also appreciate the initial, yet respectful portrait of Henson's professional and personal life.

"...as I read, I got to know the real Jim Henson, and he was just as funny, kind, imaginative, intelligent, and crazy as the little glimpses of him that..." Read more

"...and driven, with a sort of innate inner strength and conviction, and compassion, excitement and faith in his fellows and the world...." Read more

"...man behind Kermit the Frog, you will discover a curious, intelligent, kind, gentle human being who was truly loved an respected by those who knew..." Read more

Customers are mixed about the pacing. Some find the author's writing style and pacling of the book interesting, while others say it started off slow and dragged a bit.

"...Not a big issue, but it's there. Secondly, whilst maintaining a good pace, it strikes me that the narrative is very subdued: there is no ups and..." Read more

"This book started off kind of slow but it picked up and was hard to put down...." Read more
